summary: This document is a formal response from Google LLC to a Grand Jury Subpoena dated October 23, 2019, regarding an investigation. It includes a cover letter detailing Google's compliance and objections, a Certificate of Authenticity for the produced data, and an attachment listing hash values for the production files. The letter is signed by Jeremy Paduano from Google's Legal Investigations Support.

persons.name: Jeremy Paduano
persons.role: Google Legal Investigations Support / Records Custodian
persons.context: Signs the cover letter and the Certificate of Authenticity on behalf of Google LLC, certifying the authenticity of records produced in response to a Grand Jury Subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A Grand Jury Subpoena was issued, referenced by Google Ref. No. 3011708, requesting documents and information from Google's systems.

events.title: Google's Response and Certification
events.description: Google submits its response to the Grand Jury Subpoena, including a cover letter and a signed Certificate of Authenticity for the produced data.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Google received a Grand Jury Subpoena dated October 23, 2019 (Ref. No. 3011708) as part of an investigation.
Google conducted a search and produced responsive information from its systems, accompanied by a Certificate of Authenticity signed by Jeremy Paduano.
Google objected to producing records for accounts not expressly identified in the subpoena, stating such a request would require a court order under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2703(d).
The document includes hash values (MD5 and SHA512) for the produced files to ensure data integrity and authenticity.
Google notes that Google Pay service data is controlled by a separate entity, Google Payment Corporation, and must be requested directly.
